description: From French roulade, from rouler (“to roll”), from Old French roler.

entries.meaning: (music) An elaborate embellishment of several notes sung to one syllable.
examples: He heard only here and there the ecstatic burst of a mocking-bird's wonderful roulades.

entries.meaning: (cooking) A slice of meat that is rolled up, stuffed, and cooked.

verbs.description: roulade (third-person singular simple present roulades, present participle roulading, simple past and past participle rouladed)

entries.meaning: To sing an elaborate embellishment of several notes to one syllable.
